website_summaries.verdict: When completed, this kit uses more than 1,900 LEGO bricks to create a 1:110 scale model of the Saturn V rocket used to launch the Apollo moon missions.
pros: Measures at least 39"H x 6"W in diameter
Includes lunar lander and orbiter as well removable first, second, and third rocket stages
Includes booklet so you can learn about the Apollo missions
Comes with stands for horizontal display
cons: Because it is so long and slender, it can be unstable

customer_reviews.title: So impressive and totally worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: This is perhaps one of the most significant LEGO sets of the century. This set is massive and will be an absolute hit in your household. Take advantage of the awesome price to piece ratio and enjoy this set that will blow you away in sheer size. Also, take advantage of the frustration-free packaging, as this will ensure you get an undamaged LEGO box as it comes directly from LEGO in a tightly fit box. Two thumbs up for this amazing set. If my review was helpful, please click on 'helpful' below. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask. Happy bricking.
customer_reviews.author: The LEGO GuyTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: Listing is for the new release, NOT the original set!
customer_reviews.text: Be forewarned, this is NOT the original Saturn V set released by LEGO in 2017. This is the new release under the new set number. The Amazon listing for this is incorrect. Still a great deal and a super fun build, but just know you aren’t getting the original.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R. Ruffing

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together at your own pace
customer_reviews.text: I haven't purchased Legos since I was a child (a while ago) and this idea of numbering the bags so you can build the rocket in order and without digging through all the pieces at once is AMAZING. I am building this with my 4-year-old daughter and she gets bored after about one bag. So we are going at our own pace and doing one bag a weekend. It's fantastic. Generally speaking, the craftsmanship has also gone up. It's amazing what they can do with Legos these days. Lots of moving pieces and various things like hoses etc that really give the rocket a realistic look. Nothing but love for this Lego set.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Durden

customer_reviews.title: Houston, we've had no problem
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! This model is tall. My son is 15 and wanted something sciencey. He built the kit over three sittings. and it turned out beautifully. He had one small issue with the first section, but the interior of the structure is intricate, and I immediately figured out what the issue was. Small pieces warning for little builders. This thing is solid! It can be displayed upright, or laterally resting on a series of supports. They give you a lunar landing module scene and a splash down scene. It's a good replica of the Saturn V, but not as detailed as you'd expect from such a large vehicle. Generally speaking, it's an impressive Lego, but it requires some skill
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Historic Space Rocket a Challenging Project
customer_reviews.text: Since this is the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 Moon landing, I wanted to get a Lego project for my grandson, age 7. He is very good at following the Lego assembly directions on any project. He already had the small Space Shuttle kit. However, there is no intermediate project between that, and the full-blown Saturn V Apollo Rocket. So we did order the Saturn V, although $110 was a bit more than we originally intended to pay for his birthday gift. I am sure he will be able to assemble the rocket, one stage at a time. I am impressed that it does also include the command module and the lunar lander.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Okie

customer_reviews.title: Great Value/Set and Shipped Protected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Frustration Free Packaging and was shipped in a large box, which contained another cardboard box that opened to reveal the actual box for the set. Definitely did not need the first large box, but awesome that it was shipped as shown in my pic. Great value when you consider price and piece count. Much much better than what Lego puts out nowadays (purchased in Jan 2020 at $120). Great, intensive build with lots of detail. Kept me busy for about 4 hours. Huge set, great rigidity, and looks fantastic. Would definitely recommend this set to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Chung

customer_reviews.title: Very nice level of detail
customer_reviews.text: Great grandfather-granddaughter project! The level of detail - particularly the interior detail - is really nice. My dad (77) and daughter (11) really enjoyed building this together! Expensive, but a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Olivas

customer_reviews.title: A Classic
customer_reviews.text: I think this is one of the best Lego sets ever made. My 9 year old daughter assembled it herself over 3 days and the result is stunning. It is very sturdy and the details and scale are amazingly accurate, even allowing the 3 stages of the rocket to be cleanly separated. Having the lettering and images (USA flags) printed onto the surface rather than using decals is another huge plus. Best of all, we love how the assembled rocket looks more like a realistic model with a smooth finish rather than a cheap toy with Lego pegs showing. And at this price point it's a steal!
customer_reviews.author: garyburl

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of the bottom pieces, they fall off easily
customer_reviews.text: This LEGO set was very well worth it when I bought it at a discounted price. Building it was really easy though there was one specific step in the instructions that wasn’t clear. I ended up having to just use common sense. However, the disadvantage of this set is that if I try to move it anywhere else, pieces start falling off from the bottom, especially the booster pieces! I nearly stepped on one right after I finished assembling the rocket and nearly dropped it. Would’ve been near perfect had the bottom parts had more support!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: A very fun build with clever build techniques
customer_reviews.text: I've tried twice to write a more thorough review for those who really enjoy their LEGOs, but something about it keeps setting off the "this review not allow" robots at Amazon; and they aren't very specific about *what* caused the kickback. *sigh* If you'd like to read that review, contact me directly. It addresses some of the most common negative concerns (which aren't really valid IMHO). In the meantime, I guess "me likey, LEGO much fun" is all I am allowed to provide.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Quosig

customer_reviews.title: The imagination and dedication it took to design this kit is next level stuff.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! The imagination and dedication it took to design this kit is next level stuff. The instructions were straight forward and easy to follow, but you gotta pay attention to the details. It took me about 5 hours, but it's done, and standing tall and proud on my desk. Don't panic, there will be some extra pieces. There were some low reviews because the box arrived with some damage. Mine arrived in great shape. So since I'm not a collector, I ripped that perfect box open, built the kit and then cut the box up and put it in the recycling bin.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: This thing is huge....
customer_reviews.text: If you have a few days you will have a huge model of a Saturn V rocket. its not totally easy but the instructions are quite clear. I did say it is huge; over one meter when assembled. I kept mine in my university office. It looks great and it started a ton of conversations. Beware, it has a ton of parts and the various stages of the rocket come apart making it a bit fragile once assembled. Keep the instruction manual around for those times when it needs to be put back together after a crash landing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! but there was one thing...
customer_reviews.text: The rocket creation was amazing, it had a lot of detail and was carefully engineered to perfection. I had one slight problem, the box came with one lego part missing, the part name is 6022470 (a arch type piece). I was really sad because this piece completed the body of the rocket perfectly. I built my rocket on a clear space in my living room but at first I thought I lost the piece by accident but after looking everywhere for it, I could not find it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This model is beautiful. It is very large and heavy. It is built from the inside out so you get a mock visual of the internals of the rocket which is really cool. The approximations to the real rocket are very well done. This model is fascinating to look at. The playability might be a little low due to the size and weight and the fact that it would be flying, but the CM and LM can be disengaged and more easily interacted with. It comes with some scale-sized people too which is funny because you can sense how large the vehicle is. However the completed model is solidly built and can be handled at-will. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego set! Super fun to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most amazing, pleasing to assemble, fun, innovative and engaging lego sets. What a wonderful job Lego did with this set. Highly recommend for self-gift and for older kids as there are many tiny pieces (1900 pcs approx) which can get lost easily. Instructions are super easy to follow. But if you mess up then you’ll have to go back some steps. One of the lessons that I derive from Legos is being resilient and paying attention to detail. It was super fun and relaxing to put this together. Worked on it for about 6 hours.
customer_reviews.author: daniel g

customer_reviews.title: This product does not allow Lego pieces to snap together to hold!
customer_reviews.text: This product had 1,000+ pieces which was fine and a great challenge to put together each section of the rocket. But, these pieces DO NOT connect/snap together to hold in place. Each additional piece or section added caused collapsing of multiple pieces already assembled. No way could the rocket, if it had made it to total assembly, been moved. It's been added to "File 13" after 4 sections.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Knight

customer_reviews.title: An amazing build, with a couple of caveats.
customer_reviews.text: What an incredible piece of history this set represents! Had a lot of fun building it. One star off because a few of the pieces (particularly between the first and second rocket stages) do not appear to fit exactly according to the instructions and needed an alternative approach. This set also doesn't seem to have that very robust feel of a Lego Technic end product. Don't let little kids or edgy pets anywhere near it! But none of this really takes away the incredible experience of building and admiring this set.
customer_reviews.author: Vivek Joseph K

customer_reviews.title: Great Advanced set to work on with kids
customer_reviews.text: Most sub-assemblies in this set are "2x" or "4x". My daughter and son (5 & 3) had a great time following along with my example as I built. There were some places where there hands could not keep up, but this generally speaking, the build process in this model is very, very straight forward, with a clear top down assembly. I didn't buy this model with the intent to build with my kids, but it turned out to be a great building experience. Side note: This model includes very few purpose built pieces, and is constructed almost entirely from uncommon though standard Lego parts. I found this very refreshing. Great model.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set, bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: Great set, I really enjoyed putting it together. It can be displayed vertically or horizontally and looks incredibly detailed. My only problem is the set was missing 4 pieces. Luckily, I have tons of spare pieces lying around, but most people won't and it takes more than a week for LEGO to ship you the replacement pieces from Germany.
customer_reviews.author: Bananas

customer_reviews.title: Best LEGO purchase yet!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite gifts I have ever bought, and SO glad I did!! My nephew is 13 and still absolutely LOVES Legos!! This was a Christmas present. He hinted at it, but didn’t expect to get it. The light and sparkle in his eyes when he opened it!! I think he thanked me a hundre times!! Lol He worked and worked on this until he finished it. And it’s now proudly displayed on my parents’ mantle. He shows everyone! And everyone loves it!!!
customer_reviews.author: auntie

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful tribute to the scientists and astronauts who made the Apollo missions so successful.
customer_reviews.text: The end result is a beautiful model and the stage separation is a wonderful inclusion. I'm also amazed at how sturdy the model is when it's all together in one piece; it's very solid and I have no concerns when moving it or letting curious friends handle it to separate the stages themselves. The build process was straightforward as well, with several clearly labeled bags of parts preventing having to sort through one giant pile for a single small piece. It's a very well thought out set and the finished product is gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Best Lego Kit
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big fan of Lego kits. Spend a little time putting them together and that's the end of it. If the kids play with the kit it falls apart and pieces are lost. But this kit is different. Unlike all the other Lego kits that look like Legos, this rockets does not look like Legos when it is assembled. Meaning it serves as a nice decorative piece. My daughter said is was the most challenging kit she assembled (which is good). Now it decorates my office. My 5 year old twins want to know why it didn't come with the earth and moon. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Barney

customer_reviews.title: NASA fan? They will love this!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it! He recently turned 15 and when he asked for Legos for Christmas, I was perplexed because we have thousands of dollars worth in the basement; kits and free form blocks. I began my search for something that would challenge him. This was the perfect choice. It’s huge and is taking him time to build. It’s something I’m sure he will display in his room once he’s finished. He loves aeronautics and space-related topics. This was a big hit!
customer_reviews.author: C L D

customer_reviews.title: Unconventional LEGO build techniques
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I would mention is there are building techniques in the manual that may be challenging for children and even adults. But for most, part of the experience is building it and figuring stuff out. This is a fantastic price for this set. It fits all aspects of a great LEGO set. It is large, unique, fun to build, AND is a functional model with removable pieces instead of a fixed set. Plus it is educational. It includes an informational magazine with the build manual. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by this set. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Buster Matheson

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Lego Set!!!
customer_reviews.text: Where to even begin!?!?! This set was by far one of the best sets we have put together. The attention to detail is phenomenal!!! The instructions were clear and the 12 divided bags of parts allowed us to build a little each night. The history of the NASA program that is written throughout the manual was a great touch. It also comes with the display support posts (need to assembly), so we are able to have it out all of the time. We can't wait for more of these sets!
customer_reviews.author: JDub00

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome tool to teach your kids about the moon landing mission
customer_reviews.text: Got it on sale for 90 and it is a good value to start with. The tight fit frustration free packing is ok but the corner of the Lego box was crumbled a tiny bit. If you are collector, please beware. There are 12 packs in the box, the instruction goes from stage I to the top. However, you can start building from any stages as they are modular. While building the Saturn V, you can tell your kids how much effort we spent to put man to the moon and return safety. This is what we should proud of.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Nerd-Puzzle Ever!
customer_reviews.text: With nearly 2000 pieces, this fabulous nerd-puzzle is a labor of love. The instruction book is long, complicated and will be a real challenge for anyone willing to take on this 3D puzzle; this is not easy! My lady and I did this during the pandemic and it kept us busy for days. As an aside notation, it's impossible to assemble this Saturn V rocket in anything less than many, many, and sometimes frustrating hours. This LEGO puzzle was and is great fun for the nerd in us all----try the challenge!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Balog

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I received the Saturn V sold by Amazon in frustration free packaging yesterday. I was concerned that I would received an item recovered from damaged packaging that might or might not have all of the pieces. I was pleasantly surprised to receive a brand new set in standard LEGO packaging. And I perchased it for the standard LEGO price. I'm still in shock. I purchase everything from Amazon, but never LEGOs. In the past, they've always used an inflated price, either directly or through sketchy Amazon retailers. Maybe Amazon is starting to clean up its act or maybe I just got lucky. By the way--BEST LEGO SET EVER!
customer_reviews.author: JBBuffalo

customer_reviews.title: Good value for LEGO - lots of useful pieces
customer_reviews.text: The Saturn Rocket LEGO set is one of the better values from LEGO - though I got it just last week for $20 less than I see it priced today. Go figure. It is a bit challenging which is good and has plenty of pieces that can be repurposed. I got it specifically to repurpose the pieces to make a MOC of the International Space Station for a project and it will suit that very well. But first I put the rocket together as directed. It comes with a big booklet with lots of information about the moon mission which is informative if you are interested in that.
customer_reviews.author: treelady

customer_reviews.title: It is an amazing LEGO set. Totally recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I have read some reviews saying pieces don't click together...don't know what these guys were struggling with, but definitely with attention, all the pieces attach perfectly and solidly to each other. The full assembled model is solid and steady. Can pick it up from its center and sideways, it will held itself together. The Lunar Module fits inside the rocket cargo bay, and the three stages come apart as well. Totally recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Bassi

customer_reviews.title: this is the best lego ever; super interesting build
customer_reviews.text: I have built 50+ lego sets over the past decade from the remote controlled technic to the big Falcon. This is by far the coolest build experience, most clever design, and impressive tabletop presence. The realism of the stages and scale is amazing. The pieces are topnotch--no stickers, no expense seemingly spared. Buy it; I can't imagine you will regret it. The only slight drawback is that it more of a show piece than a rough-and-tumble kid's toy.
customer_reviews.author: Koan

customer_reviews.title: You know you want it, just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: My son is only 7, and he put this thing together in one day, all on his own. He had this on his Christmas wishlist, but I wasn't about to buy him such a huge expensive Lego set. But, then I got a notification that there was a cyber Monday special, so into the cart it went! Seriously, if you are reading reviews of the Saturn V Lego set, you know you want it, just buy it and clear your fireplace mantle while you wait for it to arrive. Because, once you get it and put it together, that's where you display it.
customer_reviews.author: dusty_puppy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kit!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted this kit for quite some time and finally decided to get it after Lego discontinued it on their site. It took me about two weeks to put together since I only did a bag a day to spread out the build while in COVID quarantine. It is a very impressive model and size when completed. I'm glad I got it before the profiteers jacked the price up for their benefit after it was discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: ic_red

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lego set!
customer_reviews.text: This lego set is beyond amazing! It is a tough build (definitely pay attention to the instructions at every step!) it takes a few hours! It’s solid and massive! So much details through out the entire process but so fun to put together! My 9 yr old who is obsessed with all things space was ecstatic to receive this at Christmas! Seriously an amazing lego set for any lego lover, especially those that are obsessed with space and nasa!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Personally I was disappointed the way some of the outer panels are held ...
customer_reviews.text: As expected , my son was able to finish the assembly in about 4 hrs . Personally I was disappointed the way some of the outer panels are held in place , more of a design issue. They move around after assembly and lot of flat surfaces on what should have been curved panels. Overall it was fine for a kid to work on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this Rocket
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Rocket because I grew up in the 60s.. Took me about ten hours to complete, but was a lot of fun.. Orientation as your building this is a very big deal.. When you're adding pieces, keep it orientated just like the picture shows or you could be putting the pieces in the wrong place.. I'm making my own launch tower cuz Lego discontinued theirs.. Why would they still sell the rocket and not the launch tower.. Lego, if you're if reading this, Please bring back the launch tower, you'll sell a ton of them..
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: LEGO and NASA, what's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best LEGO sets I had the chance to put together (and I have the UCS Falcon). Unlike a lot of the Star Wars series and Marvel series sets, the Apollo has a very different design and is a lot of fun. There were as least 5 "Whoa" moments, and I'm not going to spoil it for you guys. The only complaint I have is it only took me 6 hours to put together, can't get enough of it!!!
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: I hope the rest of the LEGO projects I’m going to buy are as good as this one!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 5. We worked on this together because the adult part comes from having large hands, being able to trace missteps in construction, and paying $120 (at fair market value) for it. When you get this set, you will realize $120 is a bargain. It is MASSIVE, well thought out, and will make you “Proud to be an American,” or even just a member of the human race, for that matter...during construction, you build the insides and appreciate what the Saturn V is: one of the finest technical achievements of mankind EVER.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Darius Rehmer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic set
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is the first large Lego set I've built. Ever since it was released I've been watching it so I can get it at at MSRP or less and got it for myself as a Chrismas preset. I enjoyed assembling it immensely, and it's a fantastic model. I would recommend it to any space enthusiast. The spare pieces it came with were the perfect ones for the "Oh crap I dropped that and can't find it!" ones and it went together without a hitch. Highly recommended. It's very sturdy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ophidia

customer_reviews.title: Great space STEM gift
customer_reviews.text: My 9-yr old son loves building Lego and learning about aerospace/space programs. This was a great gift and he built it himself in about 6 hrs (his target was 4 hrs). The final assy can be separated between the 3 stages of the rockets and all of the modules (eagle, columbia) and the lunar landing. This was a great learning video and he was using the lego parts to learn about Apollo 11 mission from PBS to mimic all glorious actions by Armstrong, Aldrin, and Miller. Great gift
customer_reviews.author: rihan

customer_reviews.title: Out of this World
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely impressive. Pictures and what you see online doesn't do this thing justice. It really is a 110 scale of the actual rocket and it's just so bloody cool that I can't decide between standing it up or displaying it sitting on it's side in sections. OMG I'M BUYING ANOTHER LOL. I do recommend that you go to lego.com and buy 3 more identical stands like the ones included so you have 2 for each section or it won't be sturdy and could fall off.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Large, challenging build but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My 8-year-old LEGO lover. He built this on his own with only a few errors that had to be corrected later. He loves the historical information in the book. This build is huge and details in the schematics are easily missed. It isn't the sturdiest of builds so grab some LeGlue to keep it together and save yourself some frustration. Double check the pieces you build onto and the spacing.
customer_reviews.author: TheBlueAnura

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lego Build
customer_reviews.text: This set was really fun to build. The instructions were clear and the build was challenging. Has to be the most fun I’ve ever had with a set of Legos. The scaled mini figures were a nice touch to show how massive the Saturn V really is!
customer_reviews.author: Bran

customer_reviews.title: First LEGO set I’ve built in over 40 years...absolutely LOVED BUILDING IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and bought myself a LEGO Kit after seeing all the terrific kits they’ve been coming out with. It was a blast putting this together. The kit came professionally packaged and as a result, there was no damage and everything was there. After building this amazing set, I’ve gotten the bug to build more. So I will, starting with the modular town buildings, as they appear to be highly detailed with enough parts to eep me busy for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Stumpy

customer_reviews.title: If you like Legos and the Space program... buy it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - really cool - tiny "figurines" (if one call them that) are to scale, so not the usual lego stuff. Think pinky nail size. - looks like the real deal. Go to visit Cap Canaveral, they have one on display there... - you can separate the different stages relatively easily - designed by passionate lego builders. Really cool. Cons: - it's really large once built, and the stands are not very stable. - it's expensive
customer_reviews.author: T.Perraut

customer_reviews.title: Big, Beautiful, Fun & Satisfying
customer_reviews.text: Just look at the pics. It's not super hard to put together because the instructions are easy and the parts are sorted by module in separate bags. Nonetheless, one feels a sense of satisfaction with the hours devoted because the end result is so big and impressive. Lego's engineers hit a home run with this model. It's a little daunting at first because of the number of pieces and the size of the instruction book, but you won't be disappointed with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Beanman56

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic set with wide ranging appeal. A must have even for non-Lego people!
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic set, perhaps my most favorite Lego set to build in a very long time. Until you have it in your hands it is hard to appreciate just how tall and hefty it really is. As I was building I was worried about some of the structure stability for the internal cylinder, but the designers used several clever and fun methods to lock everything into place. It is a shame so much of the internal structure is hidden away. If ever there was a set that begged for a second "cut away" style build this is the set.
customer_reviews.author: Erik K

customer_reviews.title: Out of this world
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for Christmas. This was his "big" ticket gift that he asked for. He is 18 years old. He built it in about 4 days, not continuous building but on and off. This is so amazing! I would recommend it to anyone who loves Lego's, Space, History.... There are a ton of pieces, so I would not give it to a young person. Must have patients!!
customer_reviews.author: crow

customer_reviews.title: my 4 year old son is proud of himself for building it
customer_reviews.text: yes, a 4 years old can do it! it doesnt mean that this is an easy set of lego, just that if you love lego enough, you will spend the time to do it right and follow the instructions to the letter. this is a complicated set, it looks simple on the outside but inside is amazing with tons of details that only the builders will truly appreciate (because it is all covered up afterwards)
customer_reviews.author: EvilTechie

customer_reviews.title: Great value  Beautiful display.
customer_reviews.text: No doubt this is a very nice set. The instructions are right on. I am pushing 80 and have had carpel nerve damage that was just operated on. I thought this would be a good test to see if my hands still worked. Well they did. This is pretty simple to assemble if the instructions are followed. One bag at a time. When finished, I had 5 spare pieces. Mostly the small caps.
customer_reviews.author: J. Busse

customer_reviews.title: Impressive detail and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone with any interest in space will love this LEGO model. Impressive and an absolute bargain. Because of its height to width dimensions it is risky to leave it standing but it is how it looks most impressive. My own solution was to simply put it in a chemistry stand with chemistry stand ring, which is very stable and do not detract from It. See picture
customer_reviews.author: J Explorer

customer_reviews.title: The detail in this model is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought me this for my 58th birthday because she knows I loved watching the Apollo missions when I was young. It comes with a really good instruction manual with each step in a separate numbered bag. I did one bag a night and it was a great way to relax after a stressful day. Being able to separate each stage and view the engines is a great touch. I would love to have more of these, like the Shuttle and even the newer ships like SpaceX. My 7-year-old grandaughter helped me and she loved it too.
customer_reviews.author: John M Harley

customer_reviews.title: Price came down a bit; I jumped on it.
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine got this kit fairly early, and I got to watch her working on it. It really is a nice design -- lots of detail, and a challenging but not unreasonable build -- and having watched the Apollo missions as a kid I definitely wanted one for myself... but the $120-130 it had been running at was just over my pain point. At under $100, I could no longer resist.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kesselman

customer_reviews.title: Was missing a single piece, but everything else was great
customer_reviews.text: The entire set was great to put together and is a great centerpiece. There was a single piece that was missing, a flat 6x6 platform, but thankfully I have a large collection and was able to find a replacement. Besides this, it's a great looking set with a good amount of historical value. My only disclaimer is that it is ~3 feet long/tall so you will need to have a space to put this set.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Amazing set but hurry up and grab it
customer_reviews.text: For those that are curious about the recent resell and drop in price, its because its the re-release lego had planned. I received my box with the new set number and not the older one from 2017. I recommend getting the set right now as Lego will officially release it on November 1st.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Reyes

customer_reviews.title: This cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.text: T-H-E LEGO set to get! My 7 year old is finishing 1st stage. I looked at his work the other day (this was his Christmas gift for 2017) and I was blown away with the details. Waited for weeks for Amazon to replenish stock as the "scalpels" were charging more than retail. At $109, this is absolutely the best set to get. Get it, you or your kids will not be dissapointed. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: b.deren

customer_reviews.title: Stop waiting. Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Great LEGO set! I would definitely recommend this set. Assembly wasn’t too difficult because the pieces are bagged in order for assembly. I believe there are about 20 bags or so. Unfortunately, I recently dropped the finished product which caused hundreds of pieces to go flying! I really wish I would have used some sort of LEGO glue when I finished because now I have to try to reassemble without the help of the numbered bags. Wish me luck!
customer_reviews.author: Chad D.

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive Work
customer_reviews.text: My son (8) and I worked together to construct this lego and he didn't have enough patience to work with the pieces in the manner suggested in the instructions. Some of the placements take quite a lot of nuance and a gentle, skilled touch, which is what makes this line interesting to older kids. Unfortunately, my son lost interest quickly and we still have a half completed shuttle, three months later.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift for space enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas from my wife. First time I got a Lego set for Christmas in a long time, lol. I was stoked! I spent most of the day into Christmas night building it with the help of my son and daughter. This set is amazing, all the little details and the stage separations, everything, awesome. This is my new standard for the best Lego set ever.
customer_reviews.author: Armand A.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Lego set!
customer_reviews.text: This Saturn V Rocket is an awesome representation of what man can create. I am a fan of all things space. This set took me back to when I first learned of space flight, and how amazing it all truly is. Lego did a great job of making this model. If only they would make a crawler to go with this set? Hint-hint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale. What an excellent set. As a huge fan of space, this is an amazing display piece. It was not hard to build and each stage was very fun to put together, not monotonous at all. The end stages are easily pulled apart and can be displayed upright or horizontally. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: frabjousdayTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Lego Maniac Since Birth
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set for the 12+ crew. I myself remember the 90's and had a blast with this. It may be a little tricky for younger builders but that's part of the fun, it most likely wont be a build in one day project. Now it's on a bookshelf in my house now because it's such an amazing design that it functions almost as a piece of art.
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Warrington

customer_reviews.title: Feels like Xmas morning all over again
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get this for retail pricing and couldn't be more happier. Been watching the price gougers take advantage of this item and as much as I wanted it.. I didn't want to be taken advantage of. Finally saw that Lego made more and never have I bought something so fast! Totally worth the price and history associated with this set. Amazing build quality. Took about 7 hours total to complete and I smile everytime I see it proudly displayed in all it's glory.
customer_reviews.author: The Toan Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: We love this lego. It's huge! It's amazing all that goes on inside the structure and how sturdy it is once assembled. I wish the stand was a little stronger but it does the trick. I'm also impressed with the price; when I saw this big of a lego, I was bummed thinking it'd be a $200+ set but once I saw the price I bought it right away. Great value and a fun build and show piece.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Chappy

customer_reviews.title: Realistic Saturn V for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This set was very fun to build, it's really detailed and intricate. Lots of inner stuff to build the panels for the outside to attach to. It really is beautiful and has all USA, Flags painted onto blocks. I haven't built anything like this ever I had to go back and had to check a few pieces as i was going but didn't hinder the progress. All in all I will love this thing for a very long time. It's solid and stable vertically so no worries there it makes a presence in the room thats for sure. So set your sight upwards to Translunar Injection and get to the moon with this great set.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: No missing parts, they all fit together well, and the manual was great.
customer_reviews.text: What else is there to say? I hadn't touched LEGOs in decades, on a whim I decided to give this thing a go. Was able to put it together in a weekend. There are 12 bags of parts in the box, which makes the idea of putting together almost 2,000 parts easier to imagine and manage. It was fun to do. Looking forward to another set catching my eye.
customer_reviews.author: Ablaut "Buddy" Reduplication

customer_reviews.title: Lego Frustration Free Packaging - set and box is identical to retail product
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to say that we bought this as an "Amazon Frustration Free Packaging" product, and it was identical the the normal item in every way, except that nifty Lego product box was inside a form-fitting cardboard box inside the shipping box. Go figure. But everything else was the same (except the price, which was $20 cheaper). And it's a great set.
customer_reviews.author: Homeschooling mom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine showed me this Lego last week. I bought it the same day. It is amazing. My 4-year old child (quite an expert in Lego at this point) and I are spending hours building this amazing rocket. It is challenging though. I intend to use it to teach him about the Apollo missions, NASA, etc. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: alf

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved the space program since growing up in Florida. While I wasn't alive during the Apollo Saturn V missions, it was great to own a piece of history to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Apollo missions. It is something that I will keep for a long time. The accuracy of having different modules detach and be displayed separately is quite unique and very innovative. I'm thoroughly impressed with this purchase. It took about four hours total across three days, I believe. It is a manageable project and wonderful collectible for all the space nerds in your life!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jones

customer_reviews.title: This lego set is a masterpiece.
customer_reviews.text: Dear Mr. Bezos, I first want to thank you for keeping your store so well stocked. You surprise me with the selection daily! This lego set warmed my cynical heart. Not only did building the lego set remind me of being a child and building legos but it helped me rediscover my passion for astronomy. The set itself is flawless with details you will notice during construction that will remain hidden forever once everything is finished. If you want a really fun 4-5 hour project i think this would warm anyones heart. Thank you for selling this to me, Mr. Bezos. Sincerely, Jefferson
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - one of the best Lego sets ever!
customer_reviews.text: The detail in this set is incredible. It was fun & easy to build and very educational as well. The rocket is built to scale so the astronauts are the size of a tic tac. As other reviewers have noted, it is on the large size, but it can be displayed either horizontally or vertically. It's really a great set and price-wise an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: MVG

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Such a neat set! The size itself is really impressive and the detail is remarkable. The build was fun and it was cool to see the unique techniques for creating the smooth round exterior. Very solid construction, can easily be held in one hand on it's side without breaking and the separate stages make it possible to display in several configurations. Can't recommend this enough
customer_reviews.author: J. Cole

customer_reviews.title: This thing is massive with lots of details
customer_reviews.text: This rocket is massive. I love large LEGO kits and I throughly enjoyed building this kit with my gf. It took the two of us ten hours to build it together. This is a great representation of the Saturn 5 rocket and it comes with a great instruction book. Hopefully LEGO will make a model of the new SLS.
customer_reviews.author: Bowler Hat Guy

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic set. Though a ton of pieces, the individualized bags makes this very doable and allows you to easily pace yourself over the course of a week. I had so much fun putting it together with easy to follow instructions and excellent attention to detail from the makers. Be aware, this piece has serious heft and size so handle/display accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: guy incognito

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Buy it right now!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, if you're looking at it enough that you're reading reviews, just buy it. Fun to assemble, fun to play with, fun just to look at. Most of the time I just build them then give them to one of my nephews, but this one is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old grandson. I hoped it would take him at least a week to complete. It’s was delivered yesterday at 12:45 and he completed it today around 4, 15 hours tops. He’s thoroughly enjoyed the process. I like that it comes with a booklet telling about Saturn V. My Father worked at NASA during these years and it brought back good memories.
customer_reviews.author: KIM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This kit is amazing and the end result is one massive rocket! I have no idea where to display or store it as it's so large, but man, it's beautiful! It took about 8 hours to build by myself so keep that in mind (I take lots of breaks and get distracted). Highly recommended for expert builders and serious fans of the Apollo space program.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding model
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (for myself) when my nephew came to visit. We put it together and used it as an opportunity to learn about the space program. I really apprietiated the way the different section were broken up into various bags of Lego bricks. The only hard part was whether to display the final model at home or at the office.
customer_reviews.author: Dop

customer_reviews.title: Complex build for a simple model
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to say this is the best *model* Lego has ever put out, details abound and it does have a surprising amount of playability with the detachable sections and hidden gems like the functional lander. Some of the best parts are actually the box and the instruction manual, which are both top quality and printed with some fantastic points and information on the history of the rocket and the design.
customer_reviews.author: StykeTop Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Great LEGO set commemorating the iconic Apollo mission.
customer_reviews.text: LEGO knocks it out of the part with this set! 1969 pieces (a nice, subtle nod to the launch year) and lots of advanced building techniques. The instruction book has a few pages that talk about the history of the Apollo mission, and as always the set is high quality, and has a number of nice details and "play" features.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perry

customer_reviews.title: I love this set!
customer_reviews.text: I finally bought this set after wanting it for years. It was a nice stress relief project. The book was very easy to follow and it does come with the original box even if you get frustration free packaging as I did. It was fun to put together and looks really cool once complete. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Clark

customer_reviews.title: the best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: Nice tall and steady space shuttle with high quality design and very satisfying looking. my 15 year old son loved it soooo much. only my problem with my son is, he carrying that tall thing around anywhere he goes, because he love that so much. Thank you Lego and Happy Anniversary to the Apolo 11.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the naysayers
customer_reviews.text: If you rated this product 1 star [(other than the people complaining about shipping conditions) which incidentally is an Amazon problem not a lego problem] you shouldn't be building lego sets. Find another hobby. This set is incredible and the finished product is an awesome showpiece. But buy it now while you can still get it for retail. Ill always regret not buying the Black Pearl before it went out of production and onto the secondary market.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen Kang

customer_reviews.title: Great Set and makes a great Birthday gift!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loves lego and space so as soon as I saw this I knew it would be the perfect gift. He loved it and started right away. It looks great on display and through out the whole process he would comment how accurate it was and how everything fit together perfectly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Out of this world!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on an Amazon special for my 12-year-old for Christmas. It is HUGE. It thankfully took him the better part of two days to put it together. (We like kits that take a long time... bigger bang for the buck.) He typically does a Lego build and then tears it apart to build something new. Not this one! This one is a keeper. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great experience for my son
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for a bday gift after we had taken a trip down to the Kennedy Space Center. Building it was pretty basic Lego but the cool part about this is that when it's done you can break it down and learn how the original rocket worked. Easily one of Lego's best.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barnes

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Lego build to date!
customer_reviews.text: This set is spectacular, the detail in unprecedented. I highly highly recommend this for any Lego, or Space fan. It is a bit of a complicated build but 10+ should be able to do it if they are familiar with lego instructions. Love this set!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: ordered a 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: This set is AMAZING; an incredibly fun build. My daughter and I worked on it, and as she built I was telling her about what was inside the rocket (1st stage, 2nd stage, fuel tanks, etc.). So it was fun and educational. And that's... its a big model (slightly over 3'), and its just 'fun.' Its beautiful, the hull marking are correct. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Dresbach

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but good things to say. I do wish LEGO instructions would include either a “ok to glue” or “not ok to glue” icon as part of each step. Given this can be taken apart into its various stages it would be nice going into what you could glue for added strength without screwing up its form/function.
customer_reviews.author: rh

customer_reviews.title: Just wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a fan of all space investigation and Science related topics, and this Lego model goes pretty well with my taste!! Big, beautiful, detailed and realistic! You cant ask for more. Go for it you will not regret buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: I loved it even with the instruction hiccups!
customer_reviews.text: It was amazing putting this together. I could have completed it easily in one day but you can break it up into different days easily because the pieces are put into numbered bags with individual instructions for each section of the rocket. I did fumble a little with the instructions a little but it was easy to come back from. Built in 3 days. Disassembled in 3. I also lost a piece and LEGO sent me a knew one for free! My OCDness was sated! ♥
customer_reviews.author: Kippie Larew

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego model
customer_reviews.text: Like almost any other Lego, this product is a joy. Building it results in a replica that is about four-feet tall. Be aware that this product should be purchased for a child with some persistence. It involves the assembly of 1900 pieces, guided by an instruction book that is about 1/4" thick.
customer_reviews.author: CrankyToday

customer_reviews.title: A Gret Piece of History
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set for my son. He was impressed with the set's detail and the fact that the 1969 pieces is also the launch year; the only LEGO set I know of that has done this. The instructions are clear, if you're used to LEGO build instructions. Strongly recommend for people over 12-14: lot of tiny pieces and attention to detail is crucial.
customer_reviews.author: The Rickmeister

customer_reviews.title: One of the best large Lego builds
customer_reviews.text: Excellent set with brick by brick instructions, collectable manual and box. Very large build takes several hours and is about 3' high when finished. Watch others speed build it on YouTube. My son is entering his finished rocket in the county fair it looks so impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S.

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful Lego rocket. Very big  and eye-catching!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 11-year-old daughter for her birthday and she absolutely loved it! It took her two days to put it together and it is big and really draws your eye! It’s in the corner of the bedroom and definitely makes a statement. It’s gorgeous! And so big!
customer_reviews.author: Missy V.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing model.
customer_reviews.text: It’s incredible. It’s a little tricky to build but totally doable. It is really cool that it splits into the different stages and modules. It displays very nicely and really gives you a sense of the scale of it all. It also is pretty strong when handled. The only downside is that it is not very stable when vertical. It will stay vertical if left untouched. But, I have bumped that table and seen it topple. It’s not too difficult to put it back together after something like that happens.
customer_reviews.author: David Hutton

customer_reviews.title: It’s super fun to build but delicate
customer_reviews.text: It comes in labeled bags and the book of instructions is quite thick but easy to read and comprehend. My sister and I spent 9 hours building this thing. (Over 30yrs old both) Great bonding experience DO NOT DROP AT ALL !!,
customer_reviews.author: d.ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Very challenging and impressive set
customer_reviews.text: This is a very impressive kit and everything is to scale, which makes it more grown up and less kiddie than most Legos. It is challenging and time consuming, perfect for people who have mastered Legos and are ready for the next level. My builder was THRILLED with this set and couldn't wait to roll up his sleeves and start on it.
customer_reviews.author: E Family E

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Lego kit for anyone that has children interested in space. My 7 yr old son easily built this on his own. The only problem is attaching the lower rocket part to the second part. We cannot get them to stay together. Otherwise very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: michael s.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lego Saturn V
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size of the rocket. It looked awesome once finished.
customer_reviews.author: Wilhelmi22

product_meta.title: LEGO Ideas NASA Apollo Saturn V 21309 Outer Space Model Rocket for Kids and Adults, Science Building Kit (1969 Pieces)
product_meta.description: The meter-high LEGO NASA Apollo Saturn V is the perfect model rocket to both display and role play with. Packed with authentic details, it features 3 removable rocket stages (first, s-ii second, and s-ivb third) a launch escape system, a command and service module along with the Lunar Lander and Lunar Orbiter to recreate a rocket launch and splashdown landing. There are also 2 new-for-june-2017 Astronaut minifigures and 1 microfigure for role-play recreations of the Moon landings. This building toy includes an informational booklet about the manned Apollo missions and the fan designers who created this educational LEGO Ideas set. Builders have the option to horizontally display the Saturn V model with the 3 stands.
feature_bullets: Bring to life the rocket launch that took humans to the moon with the meter-high (approximately 1: 110 scale) model rocket of the NASA Apollo Saturn V. This space toy with astronaut figures lets you role play the many missions the Saturn V completed.

The Saturn V rocket kit includes 3 removable rocket stages (first, s-ii second, and s-ivb third) below the launch escape system, command and service module. Plus, there are 2 minifigures to accompany the Lunar Lander and splashdown rocket toy.

After building the Saturn V rocket, you can display the spacecraft horizontally with 3 stands. The Lunar Lander docks with the command and service modules while the Lunar Orbiter sends the rocket into space.
Recreate space adventures with this NASA toy and action figures based off of the included booklet about the manned Apollo Moon missions and the fan designers of this build and play set
This spaceship toy measures over 39-inches (100cm) high and 6-inches (17cm) in diameter. It includes 1,969 pieces and is ideal for boys and girls 14 years or older.
